開.definition: to open (transitive or intransitive); (of ships, vehicles, troops etc) to start; to turn on; to put in operation; to operate; to run; to boil; to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc); (directional complement) away; off; carat (gold); abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1er3wen2]; abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1ben3], book format

開交.definition: (used with negative) to conclude; (impossible) to end; (can't) finish

開仗.definition: to start a war; to open hostilities

開伙.definition: to start providing food; to open today's service in a canteen

開伯爾.definition: Khyber province of Pakistan; Northwest Frontier province

開倒車.definition: to drive in reverse; fig. to take a backward step; retrogressive; trying to turn the clock back

開價.definition: to quote a price; seller's first offer

開元.definition: Tang emperor Xuanzong's 唐玄宗[Tang2 Xuan2 zong1] reign name used during the Kaiyuan era (713-741), a peak of Tang prosperity

開光.definition: eye-opening ceremony for a religious idol (Buddhism); to consecrate; to bless; transparent; translucent; haircut; shaving the head or face (humorous); a method of decoration; first light (astronomy)

開刀.definition: (of a surgeon) to perform an operation; (of a patient) to have an operation; to decapitate; to behead; to single out as a point of attack

開刃.definition: to edge a knife, scissor, sword etc

開初.definition: at the outset; at first; early

開創.definition: to initiate; to start; to found

開動.definition: to start; to set in motion; to move; to march; to dig in (eating); to tuck in (eating)

開化.definition: to become civilized; to be open-minded; (of ice) to thaw

開化縣.definition: Kaihua county in Quzhou 衢州[Qu2 zhou1], Zhejiang

開卷有益.definition: lit. opening a book is profitable (idiom); the benefits of education

開原.definition: Kaiyuan, county-level city in Tieling 鐵嶺|铁岭[Tie3 ling3], Liaoning

開原市.definition: Kaiyuan, county-level city in Tieling 鐵嶺|铁岭[Tie3 ling3], Liaoning

開口.definition: to open one's mouth; to start to talk

開口子.definition: a dike breaks; fig. to provide facilities (for evil deeds); to open the floodgates

開口成髒.definition: (Internet slang) to use foul language (pun on 出口成章[chu1 kou3 cheng2 zhang1])

開啟.definition: to open; to start; (computing) to enable

開單.definition: to bill; to open a tab

開國.definition: to found a state; to open a closed country

開國元勛.definition: variant of 開國元勳|开国元勋, founding figure (of country or dynasty); founding father; fig. also used of company, school etc

開國元勳.definition: founding figure (of a country or dynasty); founding father; fig. also used of company or school etc

開國功臣.definition: outstanding founding minister (title given to reward loyal general or vassal of new dynasty or state)

開地.definition: to clear land (for cultivation); to open up land

開城.definition: Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies

開城市.definition: Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies

開埠.definition: to open up a port for trade; to open treaty ports

開堂.definition: to open a law court; to set up a mourning hall

開場.definition: to begin; to open; to start; beginning of an event

開場白.definition: prologue of play; opening remarks; preamble (of speeches, articles etc)

開墾.definition: to clear a wild area for cultivation; to put under the plow

開夜車.definition: to burn the midnight oil; to work late into the night

開大油門.definition: to open the throttle; to accelerate; to let her rip

開天窗.definition: to leave a blank to mark censored area

開天闢地.definition: to split heaven and earth apart (idiom); refers to the Pangu 盤古|盘古[Pan2 gu3] creation myth

開始.definition: to begin; beginning; to start; initial; CL:個|个[ge4]

開學.definition: (of a student) to start school; (of a semester) to begin; (old) to found a school; the start of a new term

開封.definition: to open (sth that has been sealed)

開封市.definition: Kaifeng, prefecture-level city in Henan Province 河南省[He2nan2 Sheng3]

開封府.definition: Kaifeng as the capital of Northern Song dynasty

開導.definition: to talk sb round; to straighten sth out; to enlighten

開小差.definition: to be absent-minded; to desert; to abscond from the army; absent without leave (AWOL)

開小會.definition: to whisper and chat (instead of listening during a meeting or lecture)

開小灶.definition: to give preferential treatment; to give special attention

開局.definition: opening (chess etc); early stage of game, match, work, activity etc

開展.definition: to launch; to develop; to unfold; (of an exhibition etc) to open

開山.definition: to cut into a mountain (to open a mine); to open a monastery

開山祖師.definition: founding master of a monastery; founder; originator

開州.definition: Kaizhou, a district of Chongqing 重慶|重庆[Chong2qing4]

開州區.definition: Kaizhou, a district of Chongqing 重慶|重庆[Chong2qing4]

開工.definition: to begin work (of a factory or engineering operation); to start a construction job

開市.definition: (of a store, stock market etc) to open for trading; to make the first transaction of the day

開平.definition: see 開平市|开平市[Kai1ping2 Shi4]; see 開平區|开平区[Kai1ping2 Qu1]

開平區.definition: Kaiping, a district of Tangshan 唐山市[Tang2shan1 Shi4], Hebei

開平市.definition: Kaiping, county-level city in Jiangmen 江門市|江门市[Jiang1men2 Shi4], Guangdong

開弓不放箭.definition: lit. to draw the bow without shooting the arrow (idiom); fig. to bluff; to be all talk and no action; false bravado

開弓沒有回頭箭.pinyin: kāi gōng méi yǒu huí tóu jiàn
開弓沒有回頭箭.definition: lit. once you've shot the arrow, there's no getting it back (idiom); fig. once you started sth, there's no turning back; to have to finish what one started; to be determined to reach one's goals in spite of setbacks

開弔.definition: to hold memorial service; to hold a funeral

開張.definition: to open a business; first transaction of a business day

開往.definition: (of a bus, train etc) to leave for; heading for

開後門.definition: to open the back door; fig. under the counter; to do a secret or dishonest deal; to let sth in by the back door

開心.definition: to feel happy; to rejoice; to have a great time; to make fun of sb

開快車.definition: to drive at high speed; (fig.) rush through one's work

開恩.definition: to give a favor (used of Christian God)

開懷.definition: to one's heart's content; without restraint

開戒.definition: to end abstinence; to resume (drinking) after a break; to break (a taboo)

開戰.definition: to start a war; to make war; to battle against

開房.definition: see 開房間|开房间[kai1 fang2 jian1]

開房間.definition: to rent a room in a hotel; (of two people who are not married to each other) to rent a room for sex

開打.definition: (of a sports competition or match) to commence; (of a war or battle) to break out; to perform acrobatic or choreographed fighting (in Chinese opera); to brawl; to come to blows

開拍.definition: to begin shooting (a movie, a scene of a movie etc); to start the bidding (auction); to start a trading session (stock market)

開拓.definition: to break new ground (for agriculture); to open up (a new seam); to develop (border regions); fig. to open up (new horizons)

開拔.definition: to set out (of troops); departure; start date (of military expedition)

開挖.definition: to dig out; to excavate; to scoop out; to start digging

開掘.definition: to dig; to excavate; (fig.) to explore (archival materials) and unearth findings

開掛.definition: to cheat in an online game (abbr. for 開外掛|开外挂[kai1 wai4 gua4]); (coll.) unbelievably good

開採.definition: to extract (ore or other resource from a mine); to exploit; to mine

開播.definition: (agriculture) to begin sowing; (of a radio or TV station) to start broadcasting; (of a radio or TV station) to start to air (a program)

開支.definition: expenditures; expenses (CL:筆|笔[bi3],項|项[xiang4]); to spend money; (coll.) to pay wages

開放.definition: to bloom; to open; to be open (to the public); to open up (to the outside); to be open-minded; unrestrained by convention; unconstrained in one's sexuality

開放源代碼.definition: see 開放源碼|开放源码[kai1fang4 yuan2ma3]

開放源碼軟件.pinyin: kāi fàng yuán mǎ ruǎn jiàn

開放系統互連.pinyin: kāi fàng xì tǒng hù lián

開方.definition: (medicine) to write out a prescription; (math.) to extract a root from a given quantity

開春.definition: beginning of spring; the lunar New Year

開普勒.definition: Johannes Kepler (1571-1630), German astronomer and formulator of Kepler's laws of planetary motion

開會.definition: to hold a meeting; to attend a meeting

開服.definition: to start the servers (for an online game, typically after the system has been shut down for maintenance, upgrade etc)

開朗.definition: spacious and well-lit; open and clear; (of character) optimistic; cheerful; carefree

開本.definition: book format, similar to in-4°, in-8° etc (a 16-kai format 16開|16开[shi2liu4-kai1] is roughly A4) (abbr. to 開|开[kai1])

開杆.definition: (of a snooker competition or golf tournament) to start; to kick off

開架.definition: open shelves (in self-service store or user access library)

開業.definition: to open a business; to open a practice; open (for business)

開槍.definition: to open fire; to shoot a gun

開機.definition: to start an engine; to boot up (a computer); to press Ctrl-Alt-Delete; to begin shooting a film or TV show

開江.definition: Kaijiang county in Dazhou 達州|达州[Da2 zhou1], Sichuan

開江縣.definition: Kaijiang county in Dazhou 達州|达州[Da2 zhou1], Sichuan

開河.definition: to open a river; to dig a canal; to thaw (of river)

開河期.definition: thawing and opening up of frozen river in spring

開消.definition: variant of 開銷|开销[kai1 xiao1]

開涮.definition: (coll.) to make fun of (sb); to play tricks on

開源.definition: to establish additional sources of revenue; (computing) open-source (abbr. for 開放源碼|开放源码[kai1fang4 yuan2ma3])

開源節流.definition: lit. to open a water source and reduce outflow (idiom); to increase income and save on spending; to broaden the sources of income and economize on expenditure

開溜.definition: to leave in stealth; to slip away

開演.definition: (of a play, movie etc) to begin

開漳聖王.definition: Sacred King, founder of Zhangzhou, posthumous title of Tang dynasty general Chen Yuanguang (657-711) 陳元光|陈元光[Chen2 Yuan2 guang1]

開火.definition: to open fire; to start shooting; to light the flame (for cooking)

開爐.definition: to open a furnace; to start up a furnace

開爾文.definition: Lord Kelvin 1824-1907, British physicist (William Thomson); Kelvin (temperature scale)

開犁.definition: to start plowing; to plow the first furrow

開獎.definition: to announce the winners in a lottery

開玩笑.definition: to play a joke; to make fun of; to joke

開球.definition: open ball (math.); to start a ball game; to kick off (soccer); to tee off (golf)

開疆.definition: to pioneer a frontier area; to open up new territory

開疆拓土.definition: (idiom) to expand one's territory; to conquer new lands; (fig.) to expand one's business into new markets

開發.definition: to exploit (a resource); to open up (for development); to develop

開發周期.definition: development cycle; development period; also written 開發週期|开发周期

開發商.definition: developer (of real estate, a commercial product etc)

開眼.definition: to open one's eyes; to widen one's horizons

開礦.definition: to mine; to open a seam

開示.definition: to instruct (novices); to preach; to teach; to reveal

開票.definition: to open ballot boxes; to count votes; to make out a voucher or invoice etc; to write out a receipt

開禁.definition: to lift a ban; to lift a curfew

開福.definition: Kaifu district of Changsha city 長沙市|长沙市[Chang2 sha1 shi4], Hunan

開福區.definition: Kaifu district of Changsha city 長沙市|长沙市[Chang2 sha1 shi4], Hunan

開竅.definition: to get it straight; to start to understand things properly; enlightenment dawns

開立.definition: to set up; to open (an account, a branch store etc); to draw up (a certificate, receipt, prescription etc)

開站.definition: to put a new bus or railway station into operation

開筆.definition: to start learning as a poet; to write one's first (poem, essay etc)

開篇.definition: start of literary work; opening song of ballad in Tanci style 彈詞|弹词[tan2 ci2]

開紅盤.definition: (of a store) to open for business for the first time in the New Year; (of a business) to be profitable; (of a stock market) to rise; (sport) to win one's first match of a competition

開綠燈.definition: to give the green light; to give the go-ahead

開線.definition: to come unsewn; to split at the seam

開罪.definition: to offend sb; to give offense; to displease

開胃.definition: to whet the appetite; appetizing; to amuse oneself at sb's expense; to tease

開脫.definition: to exculpate; to absolve; to exonerate

開脫罪責.definition: to absolve sb from guilt; to exonerate; to exculpate

開腔.definition: to speak out; to start speaking

開腦洞.definition: to blow people's minds with highly imaginative, bizarre ideas

開膠.definition: to come unglued; to come apart

開臉.definition: (of a bride-to-be) to remove facial hair and trim hairline (old); to carve a face

開臺.definition: start of play; opening of theatrical performance

開臺鑼鼓.definition: opening gong; gong strokes announcing start of opera performance

開花.definition: to bloom; to blossom; to flower; (fig.) to burst; to split open; (fig.) to burst with joy; (fig.) to spring up everywhere; to flourish

開花兒.definition: erhua variant of 開花|开花[kai1 hua1]

開花結實.definition: see 開花結果|开花结果[kai1hua1-jie1guo3]

開花結果.definition: lit. to blossom and bear fruit (idiom); fig. to come to fruition; to yield favorable results

開花衣.definition: to open a bale of cotton

開葷.definition: to eat meat after having maintained a vegetarian diet; (fig.) to do sth as a novel experience

開行.definition: (of a bus, a train, a boat) to start off

開裂.definition: to split open; to dehisce (of fruit or cotton bolls, to split open)

開襟.definition: buttoned Chinese tunic; unbuttoned (to cool down)

開解.definition: to straighten out; to explain; to ease sb's anxiety

開設.definition: to offer (goods or services); to open (for business etc)

開誠佈公.definition: variant of 開誠布公|开诚布公[kai1 cheng2 bu4 gong1]

開誠布公.definition: lit. deal sincerely and fairly (idiom); frank and open-minded; plain speaking; Let's talk frankly and openly between ourselves.; to put one's cards on the table

開課.definition: school begins; give a course; teach a subject

開講.definition: to begin a lecture; to start on a story

開議.definition: to hold a (business) meeting; to start negotiations

開賽.definition: to start a match; the kick-off

開走.definition: to go (of car, train etc); to drive off

開赴.definition: (of troops) to depart for; to head for

開足馬力.definition: to accelerate at full power (idiom); at full speed; fig. to work as hard as possible

開路.definition: to open up a path; to make one's way through; to construct a road; (electricity) open circuit

開辦.definition: to open; to start (a business etc); to set up

開遠.definition: Kaiyuan, county-level city in Honghe Hani and Yi autonomous prefecture, Yunnan

開遠市.definition: Kaiyuan, county-level city in Honghe Hani and Yi autonomous prefecture, Yunnan

開金.definition: carated gold (alloy containing stated proportion of gold)

開銷.definition: to pay (expenses); expenses; (old) to dismiss (an employee)

開鍋.definition: to season a wok; to take the lid off a pot; (of the contents of a pot) to start to boil; (fig.) to become rowdy

開鑼.definition: to beat the gong to open a performance

開鑼喝道.definition: to clear a street by banging gongs and shouting loudly (idiom)

開鑿.definition: to cut (a canal, tunnel, well etc)

開門.definition: to open a door (lit. and fig.); to open for business

開門揖盜.definition: leaving the door open invites the thief (idiom); to invite disaster by giving evildoers a free hand

開門炮.definition: firecrackers set off at the stroke of midnight on New Year's Day (a Chinese tradition)

開門見山.definition: lit. to open the door and see the mountain; fig. to get right to the point (idiom)

開間.definition: unit for the width of a room, equal to the standard width of a room in an old-style house – about 10 chi 尺[chi3]; width of a room; (architecture) bay

開關.definition: power switch; gas valve; to open the city (or frontier) gate; to open and close; to switch on and off

開闢.definition: to open up; to set up; to establish

開除.definition: to expel (a member of an organization); to fire (an employee)

開陽.definition: Mizar; Zeta Ursae Majoris in the Big Dipper; see 開陽縣|开阳县[Kai1yang2 Xian4]

開陽縣.definition: Kaiyang county in Guiyang 貴陽|贵阳[Gui4 yang2], Guizhou

開首.definition: beginning; start; opening; in the beginning; to start; to open

開魯.definition: Kailu county in Tongliao 通遼|通辽[Tong1 liao2], Inner Mongolia

開魯縣.definition: Kailu county in Tongliao 通遼|通辽[Tong1 liao2], Inner Mongolia

開黑店.definition: lit. to open an inn that kills and robs guests (esp. in traditional fiction); fig. to carry out a scam; to run a protection racket; daylight robbery

開齋.definition: to stop following a vegetarian diet; to break a fast

開齋節.definition: (Islam) Eid al-Fitr, festival that marks the end of Ramadan
